ticket.title: Asset change broke engine asset expansions slightly
ticket.original-body:
This recent commit
https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/0e5ee9af48f11201a3b06fb3f5a50144224ec9e8
broke our engine expansions slightly. We do not do use :all for expansions, but rather require specific groups. For some reason, we needed to explicitly add filename extensions (.css, .js) to our expansions after this change. After that (and with the fix outlined in https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/6114) they work.

version.body:
Matthew: could you provide failing test or engine example that will show the issue on master?
I added a test for engines to check that and it passes on master: https://github.com/drogus/rails/commit/b4090cd77e57d07f4ccc444387593fb41425be36
version.body-html:

I added a test for engines to check that and it passes on master: https://github.com/drogus/rails/commit/b4090cd77e57d07f4ccc44438759...

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.body-html:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
